intro: Cupaniopsis azantha, commonly known as the Australian hakea, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and dense foliage. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or greenish in color. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in harsh climates. Cupaniopsis azantha is often used in landscaping due to its ornamental value and hardy nature.
